title: Joe Root returns to ODI fold for Champions Trophy - Cricbuzz
summary:
Joe Root returns to ODI fold for Champions Trophy

Published on: Sun, Dec 22, 2024, 10:50 AM | Source: Cricbuzz

Joe Root has returned to the England ODI fold for the first time post the 2023 World Cup as he was named in the 15-man squad for the upcoming Champions Trophy.

  • Root was not considered for ODI cricket after England's poor World Cup performance where he scored only 276 runs.
  • Ben Stokes was not selected due to a hamstring injury.
  • Mark Wood and Jofra Archer lead a strong pace attack in the squad.
  • The same squad will also compete in a five-match T20I series.
“Brendon McCullum's first series as all-format head coach sees the veteran's return to the squad.”

The squad aims for strong performance in the upcoming ODIs and T20Is in India starting January 22.
newTitle: Joe Root returns to ODI fold for Champions Trophy

title: Aronian echoes Carlsen's views on classical chess after Gukesh's World Championship win: 'Don't want to see the weaker player...' - Firstpost
summary:
Aronian echoes Carlsen's views on classical chess after Gukesh's World Championship win: 'Don't want to see the weaker player...'

Published on: December 18, 2024 Source: Firstpost

American Grandmaster Levon Aronian has aligned himself with Magnus Carlsen's opinion on classical chess, suggesting that it may not be the best way to crown a world champion.

  • Gukesh recently won the World Chess Championship, sparking renewed debate on the classical format.
  • Carlsen stated classical chess is “probably the worst way” to determine a champion, favoring rapid chess as a truer test of skill.
  • Aronian pointed out that well-trained lower-ranked players can often draw against top players, which diminishes excitement for fans.
  • He drew parallels between chess and other sports, noting how rule changes can affect the excitement and competitiveness of a game.
"So basically if we train a guy like this, he will be able to, let's say 80% of the time to make a draw against a top 10 player. That’s not what we want to see as chess fans." - Levon Aronian

In conclusion, both Aronian and Carlsen advocate for a reevaluation of classical chess in how champions are determined, suggesting innovations in the format might be necessary to maintain the sport's excitement and integrity.
newTitle: Aronian Supports Carlsen's Critique of Classical Chess After Gukesh's Championship Win

  • Deandra Dottin makes her ODI comeback after reversing her retirement.

title: Virat Kohli called 'bully' in scathing attack by Australian media, fumed at for 'berating' reporter over airport row - Hindustan Times
summary:
Virat Kohli Called 'Bully' by Australian Media Following Airport Incident

Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Former India captain Virat Kohli has been criticized by Australian media for an altercation with a female journalist at an airport in Melbourne. The incident occurred upon his arrival for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series.

  • Kohli confronted a Channel 7 reporter after she captured images of him with his family, expressing his displeasure.
  • He urged the reporter to delete the images of his children, which led to a backlash from media personalities.
  • Australian reporter Tony Jones labeled Kohli a 'bully' for his treatment of the female reporter.
  • The fourth Test match of the series is set to begin on December 26, currently tied at 1-1.

The recent incident has sparked widespread discussion regarding celebrity privacy and media behavior.

Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has shared his thoughts on Rohit Sharma's batting position in the Border-Gavaskar series against Australia, emphasizing the need for Sharma to adapt and regain his form.

  • Rohit Sharma's recent scores have been disappointing since moving to No. 6.
  • Ravi Shastri supports KL Rahul as the opener after his impressive innings.
  • Shastri suggests Sharma should utilize an aggressive mindset akin to his performance in white-ball cricket.
  • Rohit has experience batting at No. 6 and previously excelled in this role.
  • The importance of attacking play and confidence is emphasized for Rohit to succeed at this position.
“I would like to see Rohit Sharma, his tactics change a bit because he can still be extremely dangerous at that number (six).” - Ravi Shastri

title: Ravi Shastri on how Rohit Sharma can rediscover his Test mojo - ICC Cricket
summary:
Ravi Shastri on how Rohit Sharma can rediscover his Test mojo

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Ravi Shastri, former Indian cricketer and coach, provided insights on how Rohit Sharma can regain his form in Test cricket, particularly when batting at No.6, a position he hasn't played in years.

  • Rohit Sharma previously averaged 54.57 batting at No.6 before transitioning to an opener.
  • Shastri suggests Rohit should apply his aggressive white-ball mindset to his Test batting.
  • He emphasizes the importance of being decisive in attack rather than being in two minds.
  • Rohit is encouraged to take risks in the first 10-15 minutes to capitalize on his strengths.
  • The role of a No.6 is crucial, and effective counter-attacking is vital.
“The last thing you want is him to be in two minds whether to defend or attack. In his case, it should be attack.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri believes that Rohit's natural game and aggressive approach will not only help him regain form but also win games for India.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri's Advice for Rohit Sharma to Find His Test Form

title: U-19 Asia Cup Women: India win maiden edition, beat Bangladesh by 41 runs - The Times of India
summary:
U-19 Asia Cup Women: India win maiden edition, beat Bangladesh by 41 runs

Published on: October 1, 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Indian women's U-19 cricket team has achieved a remarkable victory, winning the inaugural edition of the U-19 Asia Cup by defeating Bangladesh by 41 runs. This victory marks a significant milestone in Indian women's cricket.

  • This is the first U-19 Asia Cup title for India.
  • The final match was held at a neutral venue where both teams showcased exceptional skills.
  • India set a total of 165 runs, while Bangladesh managed to score only 124 runs.
  • This tournament is seen as a stepping stone for young female athletes in cricket.
"We worked hard for this moment, and it feels surreal to win the title for our country." - Team Captain.

The win not only highlights the talent of young women cricketers in India but also serves as an inspiration for future generations in the sport.
newTitle: India Wins Maiden U-19 Asia Cup Women by Defeating Bangladesh

title: BCB introduces national contracts for 30 more women in Bangladesh - ESPNcricinfo
summary:
BCB Introduces National Contracts for 30 More Women Cricketers in Bangladesh

Publication Date: October 2024 Source: ESPNcricinfo

The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has announced national contracts for an additional 30 female cricketers, aiming to enhance financial stability and expand the pool of talent.

  • The new contracts are for players who are either uncapped or have not played for Bangladesh recently.
  • The existing centrally-contracted players will also see an increased pay for the period between October 2024 and June 2025.
  • Salary increases for Grades A to D range from BDT 60,000 to BDT 120,000 per month.
  • Introduced match and series-winning bonuses based on ICC rankings.
"The women's national contract is similar to the first-class players' contract for male cricketers," stated the BCB.

This initiative represents a significant step towards fostering women's cricket in Bangladesh, providing greater financial support and recognition to the athletes.
newTitle: BCB Introduces National Contracts for 30 More Women Cricketers in Bangladesh

'Luck kaisa hai mera': Akash Deep on his battle with Steve Smith

Publication Date: New Delhi

India pacer Akash Deep reflects on his experience facing Australia's Steve Smith during his first tour in Australia, highlighting the impact of luck and support from Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Akash Deep replaced Harshit Rana for the third Test in Brisbane after not featuring in the first two.
  • He struggled initially but improved in the second innings, taking two wickets.
  • Deep expressed feelings of frustration regarding luck during his duel with Smith.
  • He emphasized the importance of discipline while bowling, especially with an older ball.
  • Bumrah provided valuable advice, encouraging consistency and discipline.
“When I beat him (Steve Smith) with my deliveries, for a moment, I thought, 'Luck kaisa hai mera' (What kind of luck do I have?).” - Akash Deep

This experience highlights the challenges and mental aspects of competing at a high level in cricket, especially against seasoned players.
newTitle: 'Luck kaisa hai mera': Akash Deep on his battle with Steve Smith

summary:
'Lot of players were crying, few locked themselves up...': How Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to India sparked rumours of rift

Publication Date: Dec 22, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The aftermath of Pakistan's loss to India in the 2023 Asia Cup has led to significant turmoil within the team, as expressed by batter Imam-ul-Haq. He noted that the unexpected defeat sparked rumors of rifts among players, affecting subsequent performances in the ODI and T20 World Cups.

  • Imam-ul-Haq attributes the team's turmoil to the loss against India.
  • Pakistan suffered a humiliating defeat by 228 runs in the Asia Cup Super Four stage.
  • The players' confidence plummeted post-Asia Cup, contributing to later failures in the ODI and T20 World Cups.
  • Imam described seeing many players crying and some isolating themselves after the defeat.
“A lot of boys were disheartened from there. I heard a lot of them crying during the World Cup; some had stopped smiling and locked themselves up in their hotel rooms.” - Imam-ul-Haq

This incident illustrates the significant emotional and psychological impact that a high-stakes loss can have on a sports team, highlighting the importance of mental resilience in competitive sports.
newTitle: 'Lot of players were crying, few locked themselves up...': How Pakistan's Asia Cup loss to India sparked rumours of rift

Ravichandran Ashwin's sudden retirement during the series against Australia has sparked significant discussions in the cricketing community. The decision seems to have stemmed from Ashwin's recognition of his position in the team and his feelings about being dropped for key matches.

  • Ashwin shocked fans and pundits by retiring in the middle of the series.
  • Former cricketer Aakash Chopra suggested that Ashwin's decision was influenced by Washington Sundar's selection in the Perth Test.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma had previously persuaded Ashwin to continue until the pink-ball Test.
  • Ashwin felt humiliated after being dropped from the Gabba Test after performing well in the pink-ball Test.
“But when Sundar played the Perth Test, then he said, that's it, I am done.” - Aakash Chopra

title: World chess champion D Gukesh's mother recalls 'tough call' of not sending him to school: 'We doubted ourselves' - Firstpost
summary:
D Gukesh’s Mother Reflects on Tough Decision to Focus on Chess

Publication Date: December 7, 2024 | Source: Firstpost

Padma Kumari, mother of D Gukesh, recounts the difficult decision to remove her son from school after grade five to pursue his passion for chess. Gukesh recently made history by becoming the second Indian to win the World Chess Championship title at just 18 years old.

  • D Gukesh dropped out of school after the fourth or fifth grade.
  • His victory at the World Chess Championship crowned him the second Indian to achieve this title.
  • Padma Kumari expressed doubts about their decision during Gukesh's performance challenges.
  • Gukesh’s recent match saw him defeat Ding Liren with a score of 7.5-6.5.
  • Padma emphasized that focusing on a singular passion can lead to success.
“This is the first time I feel we made the correct decision. He wouldn’t have been able to balance both school and chess.” - Padma Kumari

The journey of D Gukesh has not only led to a championship title but also reflects the challenges and risks faced by families supporting young talents in specialized fields.
newTitle: D Gukesh’s Mother Reflects on Tough Decision to Focus on Chess

  • Rohit Sharma faced throwdowns and continued to play for a while before seeking medical attention.

title: 'Wasn't looking to save follow on, mindset was...': Akash Deep on Gabba Test heroics with Jasprit Bumrah - Hindustan Times
summary:
Akash Deep Reflects on Gabba Test Heroics with Jasprit Bumrah

Date: Dec 22, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

In a thrilling encounter at the Gabba, Akash Deep's performance with the bat in crucial moments helped India evade a follow-on against Australia, contributing to a dramatic draw that keeps the series level.

  • Akash Deep debuted in the third Test, replacing Harshit Rana.
  • He scored 31 runs off 44 balls, forming a critical 47-run stand for the tenth wicket with Jasprit Bumrah.
  • The partnership was pivotal in ensuring India avoided a follow-on, preserving their chance in the series.
  • Akash emphasized his mindset was to simply bat without getting out, leading to a confidence boost within the team.
  • He credited Jasprit Bumrah for his guidance during the match.
“I wasn't looking to save the follow-on that day; I was just looking not to get out.” - Akash Deep

The team's spirit was high following the match, showcasing the collaborative effort in a challenging scenario against a strong opponent.
newTitle: Akash Deep Reflects on Gabba Test Heroics with Jasprit Bumrah
